legacy.full_text: @teortaxesTex maybe in some narrow way on simple coding benchmarks but i doubt it will come anywhere close to the agentic abilities or multimodality

My prediction for V4 is that it will be explicitly built to handle large codebases and complex programming tasks, with context window above 1M tokens and good tool integration for agentic scenarios. Basically new Claudes, but leaner, meaner, cheaper and probably faster.

legacy.name: Teortaxes‚ñ∂Ô∏è (DeepSeek Êé®ÁâπüêãÈìÅÁ≤â 2023 ‚Äì ‚àû)

legacy.full_text: This is what they've been wanting to do since their first models (DS-Coder). Also they always go for the hardest and highest-impact thing that takes smarts rather than intensive data labeling. So I'm afraid multimodality will not become the focus this time either

legacy.description: software dev, working on AI stuff
legacy.name: Chase Brower

result.text:
i'm cheering for deepseek but i have to throw my bit of cynicism in the ring: 

going from [o1, 2.0-flash-thinking, 3.7-sonnet] -> [o3, 2.5-pro, claude 4] seems to be a really big step up in RL scale (~10x), and deepseek is going to struggle to match that unless they get their hands on more compute

legacy.full_text:
About Claude 4:
- Failed on my hard debugging "IQ test" (o3/gemini got right)
- One-shot a complete Gameboy game, including tile-based map, accurate movement, battle system, NPCs, houses, animations. Very impressed

Claude remains my model of choice for coding
